title.rendered: AqualisBraemar signs contract with Saudi Aramco

content.rendered:
17 September 2014 – AqualisBraemar, part of Aqualis ASA, has signed a rig moving services contract with Saudi Aramco, the world’s largest energy company. The contract value is undisclosed.

Under the deal, offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar will provide offshore rig moving services over the next three years for Saudi Aramco’s jack-up rigs operating in the Arabian Gulf.

“We may be a young company, but our team consist solely of highly experienced personnel with 10-30 years’ offshore experience. This experience has secured this prestigious and strategically important contract,” says David Wells, CEO of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA.

AqualisBraemar will support Saudi Aramco with rig moving services and personnel from AqualisBraemar’s offices in the Middle East region.

Since starting operations in 2013, AqualisBraemar has already set up operations in ten countries worldwide. The company has offices in London, UK (HQ); Sandefjord, Kristiansund and Oslo, Norway; Houston, USA; Rio de Janeiro, Brazil; Mexico City, Mexico; Singapore; Shanghai, China; Abu Dhabi and Dubai, UAE; Bahrain; and Dammam, Saudi Arabia.

AqualisBraemar is a specialized marine and offshore engineering consultancy focusing on the shallow and deep-water segments of the offshore oil, gas and wind industries.

AqualisBraemar’s contract party is AqualisBraemar Marine Services LLC.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar breaks into Indian rig moving market

jetpack-related-posts.title: New head of Middle East for Aqualis
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 30 August 2016 – Marine and offshore engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar has appointed Ben Lazenby as director of the company’s Middle East operation, which now counts five offices in four different countries. Ben Lazenby succeeds Reuben Segal, who will now concentrate fully on his role as Chief Operating Officer of AqualisBraemar.…

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar opens office in Abu Dhabi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 19 February 2014 – New offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar continues its expansion in the Middle East and opens an office in Abu Dhabi. Just nine months after starting operations in the Middle East, AqualisBraemar has established offices in Dubai, UAE (regional headquarters); Dammam, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia; Bahrain;…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Qatar office for AqualisBraemar
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 4 September 2015 – Offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar continues to expand its international footprint and opens a new office in Doha, Qatar. AqualisBraemar, part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA, has opened 16 offices in 11 countries worldwide since its establishment just over two years ago. In the Middle East,…

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar appoints Qatar head
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 7 June 2018 – Marine and offshore engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar has appointed Mark McNeil Cassidy as country manager in Qatar. Mark McNeil Cassidy is a master mariner with 31 years’ seagoing experience, 24 years of which have been in the offshore oil and gas industry and five years in shore-based…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Rig inspection contract to AqualisBraemar
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Brunei Shell Petroleum Company Sdn Bhd (BSP) has awarded AqualisBraemar a frame agreement to conduct rig inspection services for the operator.
